Topic.Title: Who will be the first analyst to downgrade Amazon?

Message.Msg: He loves amzn but hates the price. He claims they are using a free cash flow valuation metric, and it's genious. I don't get it. How can there be any cash flow if you only make enough to pay your bills. Sure you pay them late, but accounts payable will always excede accounts receivable. The worse they do with margin, it seems the higher they fly. It is a transfer of wealth from the stockholders to the users. Anyone who recommends amzn as a buy is also a criminal.

Topic.Title: Who will be the first analyst to downgrade Amazon?

Message.Msg: Once: As I've said before, everyone is being herded into EXACTLY the wrong place. People who are invested in sound investments are getting killed across the board. But, there is ENORMOUS stress in the system and the confidence games is reaching its limits. Honestly, I was floored with the CNBC lead this morning suggesting the the PC is dead and Intel is being hammered for INVESTING IN DISTINCTIVE CAPABILITIES, where Amazon is systematically rewarding for wasting money on redundant distribution capabilities. I actually used to trust CNBC. At this point, it is so far gone from investing it is frightening. The entire week has been an Amazon pump and AAPL/INTC bashing exercise. Obviously, they BADLY need retail to give up on real investments and buy scams, but it isn't working because trust has been destroyed.

Topic.Title: Can someone explain how AMZN has a trailing P/E of 3,241

Message.Msg: the premise is that AMZN's investments in distributions centers closer to urban area, cloud, digital books, will start to bring enough scale that the previous couple years' of slowdown in earnings will start to hit the bottom line from being almost 0. So at 156, for example, they are forecasted to have eps of about 1.73 a share for the upcoming year. I wouldn't get caught up on AMZN's PE analysis. The stock is so far past any analsis there that it's not relevant anymore until it is. AMZN's trades on it's platform hype with constant media intros supported, and being a low float scam favorite for Wallstreet. Certainly not a mom and pop stock. There was a big short premise that earnings would decline the last 2 years such as Paulo Santos over at Alpha. He was right about the slowdown but wrong that the stock would react to it. Just an example that shorting high PE's is dangerous WS wants to keep supporting them. good luck.

Topic.Title: Expect today lots of manipulations in the market

Message.Msg: "But why CNBC won't educated retail guys on this ??" They do, here's how: "trading optionz entails risk of losing some or all of your pincipal investment. People with low tolerance for risk should read CBOE guidelines for option trading and consult their financial advisor before trading options. This is not a solicitation to buy, sell, or trade options" Aint that good enough? The SEC, FINRA, and the CBOE think so. For 3.5 yearz, Sybil haz explained how this scam iz run adnausium on this board and many otherz. If people are stupid enough to play this option buying and selling 'get rich quick' game of poker then by all meanz have at it and be the bot havin institutionz patsie at the card table repeatedly getting cleaned out. Sybil doez know this: once enough crack head retailerz catch onto this scam, the bot runnerz easy money will dry up, and theze underlying pigz that have been driven to theze levelz will absolutely TANK. The problem iz that there are alwayz plenty of crackhead retailerz that say "this time iz different, i can buy this week's, this month's, this year'z LEAP put and make a fvck in fortune". For the game to end the retailer must put down the optionz crack pipe, and if they are too broke to short the underlying then they must move on to a cheaper stock gamble and away from the siren call of optionz (especially thoze cheap weekly onez invented 4 yearz ago), or they will lose EVERYTHING. Many optionz crackheadz are broke. They live in the street gutters begging for spare change and have rotting teeth. Message.Title: ever watch the computers trade.
Message.Msg: They trade 100 or 200 on the minute. At exactly 60 second intervals they buy or sell depending on their desire. If you can see their pattern you can figure out which way the stock will go in the end. It is a great way to move 35,000 shares a day without being noticed. Sure it takes a week to move 150,000 and some of these guys have a million shares so you are looking at a 2 month window to unwind a position. They know if they can hype a stock for a month or two they can get out without raising an eyebrow. To be honest I can't see the automated trades in amazon it has too much noise. I can detect it in smaller companies. But I know it is out there.

Message.Title: Q4 Earnings Announcement and stock reaction
Message.Msg: Full disclosure: I am short here (at 273) on the basis of AMZN's recent big run-up and the feeling/hope that they will stumble a little on revenue in Q4.If that happens, I see a 10-15 point drop possible. I agree with most of the analysis from people who are short, like tech (except the ramblings about the market being fixed, it's all a big plot,and AMZN falling to $100 by EOY; all delusional). My problem is I am unwilling.unable (unlike Sybs and tech) to hang onto a short position long-term. Too much risk and I am assuming AMZN will continue to roll for a long time before blowing up. I am certainly a little concerned about AMZN's strength here. I would have thought it would have continued to soften into earnings. The strength here does give me pause that a strong revenue quarter could happen. Any thoughts on the chances of AMZN falling short of the 22.3B they are expected to book in revenue for Q4? (I dont care about earnings since the market doesnt). Thanks for any thoughts and best of luck to all (especially shorts).

Topic.Title: Q4 Earnings Announcement and stock reaction

Message.Msg: Stkguy: I base nothing on the market being rigged. My $100 price target is based on actual fundamental analysis and an u derstanding of PROFIT DRIVERS as opposed to revenue. MOMO companies trade on revenue until they don t and then they get value as real businesses. That transition will happen in 2013. You cannot get to anything approaching 200 without herculean assumptions and risk of performance into 2017... The market is badly broken because of all the volatility selling. It has massively overextended in both directions. Momentum works until it doesn't...

Message.Title: Google Dropped 70-90 pts in a Second
Message.Msg: Remember the early GOOG's release last fall? All was honky dory, and kaboom!!! Unlike GOOG, the problem with AMZN is you don't know when it will make it back...1 yrs, 10 yrs? Actual results or guidance, any tiny little hint about revenue growth risk, kaboom... It's amazing folks actually play long at this point. I can understand staying on the sideline, short, even just hold (if you started really really low), but going long at this level? Simply nuts...
